name: Locanda Ca' Amadi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Locanda Ca' Amadi by using the advice they provided from their website. We used the Alilaguna Orange Route from the airport, which you get to on foot within 5 minutes. From the Rialto Bridge it is another few minutes’ walk which is very straight forward and after the one little bridge you cross there are signs for Ca' Amadi on the walls. We arrived at 12.40 and while we were expected to be asked to leave our bags and come back later our room was ready and after some paperwork we were shown to our beautiful junior suite. It looks just like the pictures. The furniture is well appointed and the bathroom has very nice fittings. It is a very spacious room, which is rare in European cities. As other have pointed out, it is a little loud. We didn't hear much honking, but some private boats ride by with their radios loud. If you are a light sleeper I would a room away from the canal. The air conditioning unit was very good at keeping the room cool, but was a bit loud as well. During the day you will hear the passing Gondoliers pointing out the balcony that is just next the window to the room and explaining how Marco Polo once owned the building. For breakfast they have a good coffee maker, a toaster with fresh bread, yoghurt, a bowl of mixed fruit (not fresh), cereals and pastries. They have a sign which states you can ask a staff member for eggs, but we didn't do this. I would recommend Locanda Ca' Amadi as a great place to stay. We ate at the Osteria Barababao which is right next door and good for days you don't want to have a long walk back after dinner, there is only a small menu, but what we ordered was very good.
reviews.title: Immaculately presented, historic B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, close to the Rialto bridge. The breakfast is very good, specially considering the scrumbled eggs. The recepion is very kind. The room was very good also.
reviews.title: Not 5 stars because of the air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the reason I didn't give a 5 stars is because the air conditioning was not working at all. We spend 2 nights there, and as the reception is closed from 7pm to 9am, we could just complain on the next day. Unfortunatly, after the complain, a guy from the recepiont got into our room, and explained how it worked and turned it on. But the air conditioning didn't work again. It was very hot, and we had to sleep with the windows opened, and as Venice is full of water, a lot of mosquitos got into our room.
reviews.title: Super Staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, those 2 nights we spend there we couldn't sleep at all, because of the mosquitos and the hot.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Venice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small Locanda has only 6 rooms and it's inside a very old and historic building. Wonderful service with very good tips for restaurant and things to do. Great location, really in the middle of Venice few steps from Rialto bridge, less than 10 minutes from Saint Mark Square. Breakfast with eggs and bacon was also really good.
reviews.title: Location location locanda!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel where the innkeepers treat their guests as though they were guests in their own home.It should be on TA's top-five list. As independent travelers, who take no tours (but who do a lot of research), this historic hotel was a treasure. The pillows are hard by American tastes, but this is more than made up for by the kind attentiveness of the manager and her family. We booked a room that faced the canal, and when we got there, it was hot and noisy; with no fuss at all, we were shown two other rooms and switched to one that faced the courtyard, which is quiet. When I needed help calling someone I was to meet in Venice, the manager quickly agreed to make the call herself. There is plenty of hot water, the rooms are sparkling clean, breakfast is good, and delicious cookies as well as water are left out at night for guests. In a city of no porters where everyone thinks assisting you with your baggage is equivalent to slavery, this manager found us someone who, for 15 euros (well worth the cost), got us quickly from the VERY EXPENSIVE water taxi--the pilot thought it beneath him to lift our luggage out of the boat--to Ca' Amadi. The hotel is situated in a very quiet courtyard, surrounded by residences; it is less than a 5-minute walk to S. Marco and all the sites. It is also near all the vaporetto stops independent tourists will use. Even if you arrive back at the hotel late, you can find a bar open to buy water, a panini, etc., or get a drink. A flight of steps up to the lobby, a step or two up to the en-suite bath in some rooms. Showers in some rooms, bath tub/shower combination in others. Bidets in bathrooms. Towels are plentiful, complimentary toiletries.
reviews.title: Gracious Service, Well-Managed, Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We absolutely loved Ca'Amadi. Finding the entrance up the little laneway was a bit daunting to my children but added to the excitement of this little hidden gem. We had the junior suite which overlooked the small canal. We are a family of 5 being three teenage girls and 2 parents. We had plenty of room in this suite. We did not find any excessive noise from the canal at all. The canal seemed to be used mainly by gondolas rather than motor boats and the couple of motorboats we saw moving up our canal were not noisy at all as they had to move very slowly as the canal is narrow. The rooms look exactly as the website depicts and the walls are actually fabric not wallpaper. Breakfast was filling and plenty of it with the attendant constantly watching and refilling supplies as required. The breakfast room has a small balcony off it that overlooks the small canal. The staff are excellent being extremely helpful with any requests we had. Ca'Amadi is close to everything and although Venice is a bit of a rabbit warren with laneways going everywhere, once you get your bearings it is very easy to navigate around. Ca'Amadi has restaurants, shops, take away outlets, a department store, gelato bars surrounding it. Very convenient position, yet quietly tucked away. I highly recommend anyone going to Venice to stay here. It is an absolute gem of a place full of character, history, romance, charm and extremely attentive staff and I hope to return very soon.
reviews.title: Exquisite piece of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at Ca' Amadi for two short days, but I loved every moment. It's old... probably the oldest building you'll ever sleep in! But functional and charming and in a great location. My room overlooked one of Venice's many canals... which is like having a prettier, but just as busy, street view. It can be a little noisy - but in a good way because you're immersed in daily Venetian life. I could see the gondolas passing my window from my bed... how cool is that?
reviews.title: Historic & Charming - Everything you want in Venice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was small but nice and you couldn't find lovelier hosts. Valentina knows everything about everything, so don't hesitate to ask her where to find the best gelato or a great off-the-tourist-trail restaurant. You really can't go wrong here, and I highly recommend Ca' Amadi for a pleasant stay in Venice!
reviews.title: Fab little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here, its is a charming small hotel tucked away down some alley ways (a bit disconcerting at first!). The information we received before arrival was excellent and made finding the hotel and access during the time the reception was unmanned no problem at all. I would highly recommend staying here and would be happy to return. The position is ideal for exploring the whole of Venice. Ca'Amadi provides a more than adequate breakfast, continental style but scrambled eggs are available on request. Great little jazz bar just around the corner too!
reviews.title: Excellent location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Calling Ca' Amadi a B&B doesn't do it justice! The quality of the room and helpfulness of the staff alone make it a true 5-star level accommodation. Very conveniently located only 5-minute walk away from Rialto bridge, it is nicely tucked away from the street noise, enjoying a view over a small canal. We stayed in the junior suite and were seriously impressed. The room was marvellous, and bathroom beautiful and clean. WiFi was free and working perfectly, the air conditioning very effective.
reviews.title: Probably our best hotel experience yet!
On the water of course
reviews.text: An extremely nice touch - you can have fresh scrambled eggs for breakfast, made especially for you. Just ask the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: An unforgettable experience!
reviews.title: Great room, location, breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great room, great people, very helpful. They had wifi, great bathroom, lots of space. Had a really great breakfast too. Was quiet, tucked away in a nice area.
reviews.title: Interesting stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fantastic view of the water, right near the Rialto bridge.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful and a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: First my thanks to Valentina for the emails prior to booking Locanda CaÁmadi. Upon arrival, after emails with detailed instructions as to location and check in procedure we found ourselves in a wonderful oasis in Venice.The room was spacious, elegant, clean, and amenities were as promised. Every site in Venice, including the train station is within walking distance of this wonderful guest house. Breakfast was fresh everyday, including eggs and bacon cooked to order. What a wonderful stay in an otherwise overwhelming city.
reviews.title: Wonderful Oasis in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a five minutes walk from Rialto Bridge. Hard to find the first time but let it explane to you first hand in detail and you will find it easily. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Valentina made two excellent reservations for dinner for us. The rooms have the typical venetian Style and are clean and nice. Breakfast is good. The place is tucked away and quiet but just around the corner you have the typical italian busy life. The best is the location.
reviews.title: Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: This guest house is small and homely, dripping in history, in a perfect location, with good breakfast and friendly and helpful staff .... all for a great price - what more could you ask for!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After looking over many accommodations in Venice we selected the Ca' Amadi because of it's Venetian style rooms and good location. What good fortune to have selected this little gem of a hotel four our eight night stay. Though only steps away from a busy walking street it's inner courtyard location gave us a peaceful and quiet respite from our daily outings. Adding to that a delightful breakfast and warm and welcoming staff made us feel like the Ca' Amadi was our home away from home. I would agree with other guests that taking the Alilaguna boat from the airport on the orange line to Rialto is much more "doable" for first time visitors after doing the route to the Fontamenta Nuove stop a few days later.
reviews.title: What good fortune!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would return again and again!
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter and I have just spent two nights at Ca' Amadi and have no complaints whatsoever. We had a suite overlooking a small canal which was, as other reviews pointed out, rather noisy at times but it all added to the atmosphere. The room was vast and spotlessly clean, the staff were extremely helpful, the breakfast much better than is normal on the continent and the location unique! We found it on arrival with little trouble, thanks to directions on the website, but getting back from a night out was a different matter....but as they say if you go to Venice prepare to get lost a time or two. We saw plenty of other people at past midnight consulting maps and not having a clue where they were!The weather was wonderful but the crowds were vast. Ca' Amadi helped us escape from all of that and we really appreciated it.
reviews.title: A hidden gem
Highly recommended
reviews.text: Thanks to Valentino for her help in booking a restaurant and to Alberto for his kind attention over the weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in August. Centrally located.....easy to get anywhere. The junior suite was fabulous.....highly decorated, clean and quiet. The manager provided personalized service and made our stay a very memorable occasion. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: We loved this little guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in August and loved it. It's centrally located 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge, making it easy to get anywhere else you'd want to go, but tucked away in its own quiet courtyard. It was also very quiet, and Valentina and her staff are exceedingly helpful. They answered loads of questions about where to wander, where to eat, what was open when, etc. They were really patient and friendly.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a standard double with no view, as that was all that was available. The high ceilings ameliorated the smaller space, the bed was really comfortable, the bathrooms and everything else impeccably clean (I'm very picky and don't say this lightly!), and the the quality of the furnishings was solid -- even the walls are lined in textiles and not paper. We did get a glimpse at some of the other, larger, rooms with views, though, and they look just as they do in pictures online.
reviews.title: A real gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The online map and information were good, the location very good as its an easy walk from the Rialto bridge, don't be put off by the decrepit alley leading to it as the Ca' Amadi is a small jewel, only one caution- there is steep flight of steps leading up to the door which would be unsuitable for anyone with a mobility problem. Once inside, the 13c building has been sensitively restored and the rooms- ours was their basic, and as such did not have a view except of another wall - extremely comfortable,quiet, very good bed, the room was decorated with thought,elegance and taste. good breakfast, european style with scrambled eggs also offered, and great coffee The staff are outstanding and really make you feel welcome and that nothing is too much trouble. We flew jet2 and prebooked a 72hr vaporetto ticket from Alilaguna which covered transfers direct from Marco Polo airport and all water bus trips including a guided tour of the islands. I'd go back there like a shot, just loved it.
reviews.title: small warmly friendly and super service

reviews.text: The hotel is close to shops and resturants.
reviews.title: Short break in Venice

reviews.title: Beautiful, small, charming hotel in good location

reviews.text: A good base to explore Venice.A good breakfast before you start.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff are helpful and kind.
reviews.title: Super Service and Small very faliliar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Have been to Venice a few times and thought that we would try this hotel. Tucked away in a small courtyard. Noted from a previous review that the reception closed at 7.00 pm and as we landed at Marco Polo at 5.00 would be a rush to get there - took the Alilaguna Blue to Ft Nova and walked, mistake as lots of bridges to naviagate, should have taken the Orange to Rialto, only a few minutes from there and one bridge.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

description: Ca' Amadi is a small boutique hotel sited in the heart of Venice, a few steps from Rialto bridge and few minutes away from Saint Mark's square. Ca' Amadi is housed in the noble floor of a palace dated back 13th century, which was the house of Marco Polo. In the 15th century the Amadi palace hosted the Emperor Frederick III. The 6 rooms, all different from each other, are elegantly furnished in the typical venetian style and are equipped with all comforts (independend air conditioning/heating, minibar, LCD TV, safe, free wi-fi).Ca’ Amadi è una piccola locanda situata nel cuore di Venezia, a pochi passi dal Ponte di Rialto e a pochi minuti a piedi da Piazza San Marco.Casa di Marco Polo a cavallo tra il XIII e il XIV secolo, palazzo Amadi fu nel XV secolo residenza del mercante Francesco Amadi, nominato Conte dall’imperatore Federico III per averlo ospitato presso la sua dimora.Storia, cultura o semplicemente una pausa dalla frenesia quotidiana: a Ca’ Amadi ciascun viaggiatore può trovare ciò che cerca.I servizi della Locanda Ca' Amadi includono connessione internet wireless gratuita, aria condizionata in tutta la struttura e molto altro.
